Package main.api

Interface TableBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MarkdownTableBuilder

    public interface TableBuilder
    Interface TableBuilder This Interface defines a set of methods for building and editing GitHub- Flavored Markdown tables. For more information on the exact specification of this kind of TableBuilder, consult the GitHub-Flavored Markdown specification. The Methods supplied by this Interface are described in more detail down below. Generally, these methods perform some sort of action on the table and then return the modified TableBuilder-Instance. These manipulations are always performed on the same instance.
    Since:
    20.12.2017
    See Also:
    ImmutableTable, MarkdownTable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      TableBuilder appendColumn​(java.lang.String title)
      Appends one empty column to the right end of the table
      TableBuilder appendColumn​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String... values)
      Appends a new column to the right end of the table and fills it with the values of the specified vector.
      TableBuilder appendRow​()
      Appends an empty row to the bottom of the table.
      TableBuilder appendRow​(Vector vec)
      Appends a row to the bottom of this table and fills it with the values of the supplied Vector.
      ImmutableTable build​()
      Creates an ImmutableTable-Instance from this table builder and returns it.
      TableBuilder forEachColumn​(VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for all columns.
      TableBuilder forEachRow​(VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for all rows.
      TableBuilder forSingleColumn​(int index, VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for the given column.
      TableBuilder forSingleRow​(int index, VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for the given row.
      TableBuilder fromFile​(java.lang.String s)
      Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied file.
      TableBuilder fromImmutableTable​(ImmutableTable table)
      Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied immutable table.
      TableBuilder fromScratch​(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new empty markdown table with the supplied amount of columns and rows+2 (for the header row and column formatting row).
      Vector getColumn​(int index)
      Returns a column.
      Vector getRow​(int index)
      Returns a row.
      TableBuilder insertColumn​(int index, java.lang.String title)
      Inserts a new empty column at the specified index
      TableBuilder insertColumn​(int index, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String... values)
      Inserts a new column into the table at the specified index and fills it with the values of the specified vector.
      TableBuilder insertRow​(int index)
      Inserts a new empty row at the specified index.
      TableBuilder insertRow​(int index, Vector vec)
      Inserts a pre-filled row at the specified index.
      TableBuilder removeColumn​(int index)
      Removes the column with the specified index from the table
      TableBuilder removeRow​(int index)
      Removes the selected row from this table
      TableBuilder setFormatting​(int columnIndex, ColumnFormatting formatting)
      Sets the formatting for a specific column.
      TableBuilder setFormattings​(ColumnFormatting... formattings)
      Sets the formatting for every column.
      TableBuilder setHeader​(java.lang.String... values)
      Sets the values of the header row to the supplied String[].
      TableBuilder setHeader​(Vector values)
      Sets the header row of this table to the values of the supplied vector.

    • Method Detail

      • fromFile

        TableBuilder fromFile​(java.lang.String s)
        Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied file. NOTE: Any data stored in the table at method invocation is lost
        Parameters:
        s - The path to the Markdown file
        Returns:
        this table instance with the content of the supplied file

      • fromScratch

        TableBuilder fromScratch​(int rows,
                         int columns)
        Creates a new empty markdown table with the supplied amount of columns and rows+2 (for the header row and column formatting row).
        Parameters:
        rows - the amount of non-header rows for this table
        columns - the amount of columns for this table
        Returns:
        A new table instance

      • fromImmutableTable

        TableBuilder fromImmutableTable​(ImmutableTable table)
        Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied immutable table. NOTE: Any data stored in the table at method invocation is lost
        Parameters:
        table - an ImmutableTable
        Returns:
        this table instance with the content of the supplied ImmutableTable

      • setHeader

        TableBuilder setHeader​(Vector values)
        Sets the header row of this table to the values of the supplied vector.
        Parameters:
        values - the new values of the header row
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with the updated header row

      • setHeader

        Sets the values of the header row to the supplied String[].
        Parameters:
        values - the new values for the header row
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with the updated header

      • insertRow

        TableBuilder insertRow​(int index)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Inserts a new empty row at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index where the new row is to be inserted
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with the extra row
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the supplied index is out of bounds

      • insertRow

        TableBuilder insertRow​(int index,
                       Vector vec)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Inserts a pre-filled row at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index where the new row is to be inserted
        vec - the values for pre-filling
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with the extra row and its supplied values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the supplied index is out of bounds

      • appendRow

        TableBuilder appendRow​()
        Appends an empty row to the bottom of the table.
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with an extra appended row

        TableBuilder appendRow​(Vector vec)
        Appends a row to the bottom of this table and fills it with the values of the supplied Vector.
        Parameters:
        vec - The values to fill this new row with
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with an extra appended row

        TableBuilder removeRow​(int index)
        Removes the selected row from this table
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the row that's to be removed
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance without the selected row

      • insertColumn

        TableBuilder insertColumn​(int index,
                          java.lang.String title)
        Inserts a new empty column at the specified index
        Parameters:

        title - the title of the new column
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one additional column

      • insertColumn

                          java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String... values)

        Parameters:
        values - the values which are to be inserted
        index - the index where the new row should be inserted
        title - the title of the new column
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one additional pre-filled column

        TableBuilder appendColumn​(java.lang.String title)
        Appends one empty column to the right end of the table
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the new column
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one additional column at the end

                          java.lang.String... values)

        Parameters:
        title - the title of the new column
        values - the values which are to be inserted
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one additional column at the end

        Removes the column with the specified index from the table
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance without the specified column

      • getRow

        Vector getRow​(int index)
        Returns a row. NOTE: This is a terminating operation, meaning that the vector has no information about this table and thus can't reach it.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the row
        Returns:
        a Vector-Instance containing the values of the row
        See Also:
        Vector

      • getColumn

        Vector getColumn​(int index)
        Returns a column. NOTE: This is a terminating operation, meaning that the vector has no information about this table and thus can't reach it.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the column
        Returns:
        a Vector-Instance containing the values of the column
        See Also:
        Vector

      • forSingleRow

        TableBuilder forSingleRow​(int index,
                          VectorOperation op)
        Executes the VectorOperation op for the given row. NOTE: VectorOperation is a functional interface.
        Parameters:
        index - the row on which the operation is to be executed
        op - the operation itself
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one modified row
        See Also:
        VectorOperation

      • forSingleColumn

        TableBuilder forSingleColumn​(int index,
                             VectorOperation op)
        Executes the VectorOperation op for the given column. NOTE: VectorOperation is a functional interface.
        Parameters:
        index - the column on which the operation is to be executed
        op - the operation itself
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with one modified column
        See Also:
        VectorOperation

      • forEachRow

        TableBuilder forEachRow​(VectorOperation op)
        Executes the VectorOperation op for all rows. NOTE: VectorOperation is a functional interface.
        Parameters:
        op - the operation to be performed
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with modifications
        See Also:
        VectorOperation

      • forEachColumn

        TableBuilder forEachColumn​(VectorOperation op)
        Executes the VectorOperation op for all columns. NOTE: VectorOperation is a functional interface.
        Parameters:
        op - the operation to be performed
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with modifications
        See Also:
        VectorOperation

      • setFormatting

        TableBuilder setFormatting​(int columnIndex,
                           ColumnFormatting formatting)
        Sets the formatting for a specific column.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - the index of the column to be formatted
        formatting - the desired formatting of that column
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with modified format settings for the desired column
        See Also:
        ColumnFormatting

      • setFormattings

        TableBuilder setFormattings​(ColumnFormatting... formattings)
        Sets the formatting for every column. If more values are supplied than columns exist, the remaining values will be discarded. If less values are supplied, the remaining columns stay unchanged.
        Parameters:
        formattings - the format values that are to be applied
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with updated format values

      • build

        ImmutableTable build​()
        Creates an ImmutableTable-Instance from this table builder and returns it. NOTE: This is a terminating operation. ImmutableTable has no direct access to this builder and can't modify its own values. A new TableBuilder-Instance is needed if further modification is desired.
        Returns:
        An ImmutableTable.
